Class Loan

java.lang.Object
domain.Loan
public class Loan extends Object
Represents a loan transaction between a library member and a book or other media.

Stores media identifier, member identifier (email), borrow and due dates, return status, fine amount, and testing-mode timing metadata.

  • Constructor Details

    • Loan

      public Loan()
      Default constructor.

    • Loan

      public Loan(Media media, String memberId, LocalDate borrowDate)
      Constructs a loan for a given media and member at a borrow date. The default due date is derived from the media's borrow period.
      Parameters:
      media - the media being borrowed
      memberId - the borrowing member's email/username
      borrowDate - the borrow date

    • Loan

      public Loan(String isbn, String memberId, LocalDate borrowDate, LocalDate dueDate)
      Constructs a loan with explicit identifiers and due date.
      Parameters:
      isbn - the media identifier (ISBN or ID)
      memberId - the borrowing member's email/username
      borrowDate - the borrow date
      dueDate - the normal due date

      Marks the loan as returned or not.
      Parameters:
      returned - true if returned; false otherwise

    • isOverdue

      public boolean isOverdue(LocalDate today)
      Indicates if this loan is overdue relative to the given date.
      Parameters:
      today - current date
      Returns:
      true if overdue and not returned; false otherwise

    • calculateFine

      public void calculateFine(LocalDate today)
      Computes fine for overdue loans using media fine per day; sets fine to 0 if not overdue.
      Parameters:
      today - current date

    • isOverdueNotificationSent

      public boolean isOverdueNotificationSent()
      Returns whether an overdue notification has been sent (observer path).
      Returns:
      true if notification already sent; false otherwise

    • markOverdueNotificationSent

      public void markOverdueNotificationSent()
      Marks that an overdue notification was sent once.

    • setTestingDurationSeconds

      public void setTestingDurationSeconds(int seconds)
      Sets testing-mode duration (seconds) and captures start time. Intended for short testing flows; does not change normal due date logic.
      Parameters:
      seconds - testing duration in seconds (> 0)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if seconds ≤ 0

    • setTestingDueDate

      public void setTestingDueDate(Instant dueAt)
      Sets explicit testing-mode wall-clock due time. If present, expiry checks will use this timestamp in preference to start/duration fields.
      Parameters:
      dueAt - testing-mode due timestamp

    • getTestingDueDate

      public Instant getTestingDueDate()
      Returns explicit testing-mode due timestamp, if set.
      Returns:
      testing due Instant or null

    • isTestingDurationExpired

      public boolean isTestingDurationExpired()
      Returns true if testing-mode duration has expired. Prefers explicit wall-clock due timestamp when available; otherwise uses start time + duration. The check is independent from the normal due date.
      Returns:
      true if expired in testing mode; false otherwise
